intro: Neurocalyx calycinus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Southeast Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a contrasting darker throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
